intro: Collinia, commonly known as the mountain holly or rock holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is native to various regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. The plants typically have evergreen leaves and produce small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or red. They often thrive in rocky or well-drained soils and are adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Collinia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological importance in their native habitats.
